Who will lead our city now?

'I'm not (totally) retiring,' Menino warns
He was an uncommonly intimate figure in a time when US cities have become anything but. And when Thomas M. Menino grasped power, he did it like nobody else.

  • Somber Menino on tenure: 'I just did what I loved'

What stood out: Menino's commitment, passion

“He’s a regular guy just like the rest of us, you know," one of his neighbors said, “and that’s how he approached the job of mayor."
